intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. nivifaucis, commonly known as the snow-veined hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It is characterized by its erect, slender stems that are often covered in dense white hairs, giving it a frosted appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish to orange flowers arranged in a single head, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a wavy or notched margin, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Hieracium bifidum subsp. nivifaucis thrives in poor, rocky soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
